block.p: Elizabeth Cary Fisher and Conrad Frederick Jalali were married yesterday at the chapel at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, of which the bride is a graduate. The Rev. Julie Norton performed the Episcopal ceremony.

Mrs. Jalali, 34, oversees direct marketing for the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee in Washington. She is a daughter of Mrs. Peter R. Fisher of Oyster Bay, N.Y., and the late Mr. Fisher, who was a partner in Rogers & Wells, the New York law firm.

Elizabeth Cary Fisher and Conrad Frederick Jalali were married yesterday at the chapel at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, of which the bride is a graduate. The Rev. Julie Norton performed the Episcopal ceremony.

Mrs. Jalali, 34, oversees direct marketing for the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee in Washington. She is a daughter of Mrs. Peter R. Fisher of Oyster Bay, N.Y., and the late Mr. Fisher, who was a partner in Rogers & Wells, the New York law firm.

Mr. Jalali, 29, is a computer programmer at Iconixx, an e-business services company in Bethesda, Md. He graduated from Sarah Lawrence College. He is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Kuchak Jalali of Ashton, Md. His father is a general practitioner in Ashton.
